intro: Lysimachia congestiflora var. atronervata, commonly known as the dark-veined chickweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial with spreading stems and small, bright yellow flowers. The leaves are typically oval-shaped with dark green veins, giving it its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. This variant is closely related to other members of the Primulaceae family, sharing similar botanical characteristics.
